official-title.#text:
To allow travel between the United States and
		  Cuba.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Export Freedom to Cuba Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Export Freedom to Cuba Act of 2013/s:3

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not regulate or prohibit, directly or
			 indirectly, travel to or from Cuba by United States citizens or legal
			 residents, or any of the transactions incident to such travel as specified in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Export Freedom to Cuba Act of 2013/s:2/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall rescind all regulations in effect on the
			 date of the enactment of this Act that so regulate or prohibit such travel or
			 transactions.

header.#text:
Freedom of
			 travel for United States citizens and legal residents

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Export Freedom to Cuba Act of 2013/s:2/ss:b/p:2
Export Freedom to Cuba Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

text.#text:
any transactions
			 ordinarily incident to travel or maintenance within Cuba, including the payment
			 of living expenses and the acquisition of goods or services for personal
			 use;

any transactions
			 incident to nonscheduled air, sea, or land voyages, except that this paragraph
			 does not authorize the carriage of articles into Cuba or the United States
			 except accompanied baggage; and

normal banking
			 transactions incident to the activities described in the preceding provisions
			 of this subsection, including the issuance, clearing, processing, or payment of
			 checks, drafts, travelers checks, credit or debit card instruments, or similar
			 instruments.

Nothing
			 in this section shall be construed as authorizing the importation into the
			 United States of any goods for personal consumption acquired in Cuba.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall not apply in a case in which—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Export Freedom to Cuba Act of 2013/s:2

text.#text: The restrictions on authority described in

the United States
			 is at war with Cuba;

armed hostilities
			 between the two countries are in progress; or

there is imminent
			 danger to the public health or the physical safety of United States
			 travelers.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
before the date of the enactment of this Act which are in effect on
			 such date, and to actions taken on or after such date.

text.#text: This Act applies to actions taken by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 102(h) of the Cuban Liberty and Democratic
			 Solidarity (LIBERTAD) Act of 1996
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Cuban Liberty and Democratic Solidarity (LIBERTAD) Act of 1996/s:102/ss:h

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 910(b) of the
			 Trade Sanctions Reform and Export Enhancement Act of 2000
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Trade Sanctions Reform and Export Enhancement Act of 2000/s:910/ss:b
